div.head: The TEI Guidelines
div.p: Un tour d'horizon très rapide du contenu des TEI Guidelines...

Dans ses 1400 pp imprimées, vous trouverez : un lexique
521 éléments, regroupés en 146 classes, et 22 modules des règles d'usage
7185 lignes de règles syntaxiques en Relax NG des contraintes formalisées
21 types de données, plusieurs règles formalisées en Schematron des règles / conventions d'utilisation
beaucoup de prose plusieurs exemples d'utilisation
dont au moins un par élément

div.head: v. A Gentle Introduction to XML
div.p:
A classic text on SGML, updated to describe XML

div.head: 8. Transcriptions of Speech
div.p:
This is a specialised module for encoding transcripts of spoken language :
it provides some additional Header elements(broadcast, equipment, recording, recordingStmt, scriptStmt)
and elements for detailed oral transcription ( incident, kinesic, pause, shift, u, vocal, writing)

div.head: 11. Representation of Primary Sources
div.p: Provides specialised elements for the tagging of physical aspects of a document such as its appearance or state of correction, as well as methods for encoding digital facsimiles and source documents

list.item: transcriptional elements include: addSpan, am, damage, damageSpan, delSpan, ex, fw, handNotes, handShift, restore, space, subst, supplied
elements for digital facsimile editions: facsimile, surface, zone

div.head: 15. Language Corpora
div.p:
Discusses the construction of large scale language corpora, and hence refers to almost all the other chapters. Also proposed a few specialised elements used to provid more detailed metadata for a corpus :
activity, channel, constitution, derivation, domain, factuality, interaction, locale, particDesc, preparedness, purpose, setting, settingDesc, textDesc

setting.name: Clermont-Ferrand
setting.activity: mise en marche de la voiture

div.head: 16. Linking, Segmentation, and Alignment
div.p:
Provides generic elements and mechanisms for
segmentation : ab, seg
(hyper) linking : alt, altGrp, anchor, join, joinGrp, link, linkGrp
synchronisation : timeline, when, et plusieurs attributs.
and associated attributes : corresp, synch, sameAs, next, prev, exclude, select.

p.s: Longtemps, je me suis couché de bonne heure.
Parfois, à peine ma bougie éteinte, mes yeux se fermaient si vite que je n'avais pas le temps de me dire : "Je m'endors."
For a long time I used to go to bed early.
Sometimes, when I had put out my candle, my eyes would close so quickly that I had not even time to say "I'm going to sleep."

div.head: 17. Simple Analytic Mechanisms
div.p:
Provides specialised elements for some commonly needed analytic features such as
linguistic segmentation: c, cl, m, phr, s,w
thematic or topical analysis interp, interpGrp, span, spanGrp
as well as the generic attribute ana

div.head: 18. Feature Structures
div.p: This chapter describes a tagset for the representation of analyses according to a widely used linguistic theory; it is also an ISO standard. Meaning is represented in terms of named features and their values, which can be organized into "feature structures" of various kinds.

This standard is mostly used to facoilitate interoperabilityt of machine lexica and other natural language processing and AI systems. It has two parts :
représentations of features : binary, f, fs, fsDecl, fsDescr, numeric, string, symbol, vAlt, vColl, vDefault, vLabel, vMerge, vNot, vRange
feature system definition : bicond, cond, default, fDecl, fDescr, fLib, fsConstraints, fsdDecl, fsdLink, fvLib, if, iff, then,

div.head: 19. Graphs, Networks, and Trees
div.p: Proposes some elements for representing a few other abstract models, specifically trees, networks, and graphs
Defines: arc, eLeaf, eTree, forest, forestGrp, graph, iNode, leaf, node, root, tree, triangle

div.head: 20. Non-hierarchical Structures
div.p: This chapter describes various techniques which have been proposed for the representation in an XML document of information which does not fit into a single hierarchic structure, notably using standoff techniques.
It proposed no additional elements for this purpose however

div.head: 21. Certainty and Responsibility

list.item: Provides elements for indicating uncertainty, precision of data or an encoding, and also the responsibility for the assertions represented by it : certainty,respons and precision

div.head: 22. Documentation Éléments
div.p: Defines elements and other mechanisms used in manuals and other documents describing encoding systems. The TEI uses these to define itself.

list.item: Éléments useful for any sort of encoding system : code, ident, att, gi, tag, val, eg, egXML.
Éléments specific to the ODD system used by the TEI: schemaSpec, elementSpec, moduleRef, etc.

div.head: 23. Using the TEI
div.p:
This chapter describes how to use the TEI architecture, in particular :
how to develop a TEI customisation
formal definition of TEI conformance
how to implement an ODD processor
